snippet: In the awakening Arab world, who is going to step up and speak the truth?
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column asserts that the countries that have undergone rapid political changes in the Arab world need leaders who will tell the populations of the countries hard truths and build broad domestic coalitions to implement new policies. (M)a
lead_paragraph: Dubai, United Arab Emirates TRAVELING in the post-Awakening Arab world, I have been most struck by how few new leaders have emerged from the huge volcanic political eruption here. By new leaders, I don't just mean people who win elections, I mean leaders -- men and women with the legitimacy and the will to tell their people the truth and build the coalitions required to get their societies moving forward again.

headline.main: Lead, Follow or Get Out of the Way
